page.title: 03EDUCATION 2
page.content: Mr.Weaver became our new headmaster in January 1985. To mark the occasion we planted a tree in the school grounds. David Bellamy had started a nationwide scheme whereby schools could obtain Elm trees for planting. These trees were produced in Canada and are resistant to Dutch Elm disease which has killed many British Elm trees over the last ten years. All the school assembled on the patch of grass at the front of the school building and each teacher arrived in their wellies (wellingtons) carrying a spade over their shoulder. A hole was dug and the tree put in. Then Mr Weaver and all the staff, assisted by some of the younger and older children filled in the hole. Rev.Evans, the vicar, helped firm it down then he took a short assembly. We sang our hymn and returned to work as usual.
